meanings.sent1: The protracted meeting lasted for hours.
meanings.sent2: The protracted winter made everyone long for spring.
meanings.sent3: The protracted game of hide-and-seek ended with everyone falling asleep.
meanings.sent4: Her protracted journey through the forest felt like a never-ending adventure.
meanings.sent5: The protracted wait for the bus felt like an eternity under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: To draw out or lengthen in time; prolong or extend
meanings.sent1: She protracted the discussion by bringing up irrelevant points.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations were protracted due to disagreements between the parties.
meanings.sent3: He protracted his bedtime by asking for one more bedtime story.
meanings.sent4: The chef protracted the cooking process to ensure the flavors melded perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher protracted the lesson to ensure all students understood the concept thoroughly.
